newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-FORECAST - Healthy Foster's profit seen.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-FORECAST - Healthy Foster's profit seen.

text.p: Australia's aspiring world brewer Foster's Brewing Group Ltd will again rely on its home market to post a solid profit for 1995/96, but shareholders will keep their sights fixed firmly offshore, stock analysts said on Friday.

The analysts tipped Foster's to announce on Monday a net profit before abnormals of around A$270 million for the year to June 30, mainly due to earnings growth from local brewing arm Carlton and United Breweries (CUB).

The average forecast for the group is much lower than the 1994/95 pre-abnormal net profit of A$350 million, but the previous result included the full contribution of British unit Courage, sold to Scottish and Newcastle in late 1995.
In 1994/95, Courage contributed 40 percent of Foster's earnings before interest and tax of A$496 million.
"There's a fair bit of growth there," one Sydney-based analyst told Reuters.
"CUB, I guess, is the highlight," added another.
In the first half of 1995/96, CUB's earnings before interest and tax (EBIT) climbed 10 percent to A$169 million and held its market share at 53 percent.
In a head-to-head branding and marketing battle with New Zealand rival Lion Nathan Ltd, CUB is reported to have built its market share to 56 percent in the second half.
Despite CUB's success at home, the real interest in Foster's results will focus on the group's offshore operations, which analysts said held the key to the group's long-term growth.
